topic.title: Associating Document Property Templates to Folders in a Folder Structure

othermeta.name: title
othermeta.content: Associating Document Property Templates to Folders in a Folder Structure

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Associate document property templates with folders defined in selected folder structures and publish templates for use in projects and contracts.

othermeta.name: tags
othermeta.content: document properties,folder structures,metadata templates,library management,document management,template publishing

body.context: You can associate a document property template to folders defined in a folder structure.

li.p: In the module menu, click Library.
The LIBRARY MANAGEMENT page is displayed.
In the navigation pane, expand Library, expand Document Management, and then click Document Properties.
The DOCUMENT PROPERTIES list page is displayed.
Select the required document property, and then click Associate Document Folder.
The Associate Document Folder dialog box is displayed.
From the Folder Structure drop-down list, select the folder structure to associate the selected document property template.
Available options are folder structures defined in the Document Folder Structure catalog of the library. For information on document folder structures, refer toDocument Folder Structure.
The folders defined in the selected document folder structure is displayed in the Document Folders section.
Select the required folders to associate the selected folder property template.
You must publish the properties template to make it available for selection in projects and contracts.
In the DOCUMENT PROPERTIES list page, select the properties template form to be published.

You can choose the applicable Document Folder Structure when creating a project or contract. You need to enter all the metadata information at the time of document upload to a folder that has been associated to a Document Properties template.
